verses.roman:
praśraya-pāgala śuddha-vaidagdhī nā jāne
antare sukhī hailā prabhu tāra sei guṇe

synonyms: praśraya—due to indulgence; pāgala—foolish; śuddha—pure; vaidagdhī—etiquette; nā jāne—does not know; antare—within the heart; sukhī hailā—became very happy; prabhu—Śrī Caitanya Mahāprabhu; tāra—his; sei guṇe—by that attribute.
translation: An intimate relationship sometimes makes a person overstep formal etiquette. Thus Parameśvara actually pleased the Lord in His heart by his simple and affectionate behavior.

purport.content: Praśraya means affection, humility, faith, a demand for some special concession, or indulgence in such a concession. Pāgala means impudence, arrogance, and influence. Vaidagdhī means cunningness, humor, beauty, expertise, learning, tricky behavior, and indications.
